reviews.text: Beware this hotel frequently baits and switches its guests! Make sureBooked this hotel months in advance and had everything confirmed by e-mail. Had read on Trip advisor that the hotel had previously baited people with the new Yes hotel to only switch its visitors to its older sister hotel. Forewarned we thought this would not happen to us. Upon our arrival at the hotel after a long intercontinental flight we were told that there were technical difficulties with our Rome and we would had been rebooked to the sister hotel. This sounded very familiar! We argued our case and told them that we would not accept this as we had read about there practices on Tripadvisor. The receptionist became very defensive and told us that the heating was not working properly and that our room would be too cold. Strangely enough lots of other guests came and went who managed to stay in the "too cold room" while were discussing this all. But what can one do when you arrive dead tired with two young children and lots of luggage in mid December in Rome? Eventually we accepted our fate and accepted our transfer to the sister hotel a few streets down the road. The hotel is nice but much older and appeared to be full of young people, it felt more like a youth hostel! Room was spacious for 4 people and the staff extremely helpful and friendly. This does not take away the fact that we felt ripped of, we were charged the same price as for the Yes hotel and got an old and much more down market hotel instead!
reviews.title: Beware

reviews.title: Bait and switch
reviews.text: It's hard to write a review for the Yes Hotel, given that we booked it but did not get to stay there. Upon arrival, we were informed that there was a "technical problem" with our room. We were then summarily packed off (with no further explanation or alternative offered) to another hotel (the Hotel des Artistes) four blocks away.

Whilst we didn't ever get to see the Yes Hotel rooms, the Des Artistes was very much at the lower end of what would be expected from a three-star - and did not resemble the reviews or photos on this website about the Yes Hotel. It is hard to avoid the conclusion that this hotel practices "bait and switch" - hook customers with internet pictures of the the much newer and nicer Yes Hotel, then send them off to a sister property down the road. Our name was already on the Des Artistes guest list when we arrived - suggesting that this outcome was organised in advance between the hotels.
reviews.title: Perfect Location made it all so easy

reviews.text: This may have been a genuine technical issue (and at least we got a room somewhere) - but if this was really the case, there should have been more explanation and support provided. It seemed that this was simply business as usual for both hotels. Indeed, unlike some other properties, the Yes Hotel adds a paragraph covering this possibility in its up-front terms and conditions - suggesting to me at least that this is a common practice.
